summary: malaria was once one of the most serious public health problems in china. but the disease burden has sharply declined and epidemic areas have shrunk after the implementation of an integrated malaria control and elimination strategy. a retrospective evaluation was performed to assess the changes in malaria epidemic patterns from 1950 to 2017. the findings from this review can probably help improving malaria surveillance systems in china, but also in other elimination countries. electronic supplementary material The online version of this article contains supplementary material.
